page.title: 14HUTTON ESTATE - GARDEN
page.content: To the immediate Northwest of Hutton-in-the-Forest is the site of an early Eighteenth Century walled garden, walled on two sides, and enclosed by a high hedge on two others, under the immediate supervision of Mr. B. Pedder. In the immediate post war period, much of this was turned over to market gardening - unsuccessfully. Now that the home is open to the public it is intended to turn it back into a formal garden to complement the home. Plans are being drawn up with the help of Miss U. Buchan. It is intended to retain the existing layout of yew and fruit trees, filling in with beds and gravel walks as appropriate, removing the vestiges of the commercial operation, including derelict greenhouses.
